intro: Malvastrum megalorrhizum, commonly known as the giant root mallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a robust root system that can grow quite deep, which helps it thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions. The genus Malvastrum is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton.
